release.change: Fixed: On narrow screens the text for calendar settings went off the screen for some translations
Fixed bugs in Android versions before KitKat
“Show changes” in about dialog now shows all changes directly
Fixed typos
New launcher icon
Added settings screen
Added possibility to change language

It is now possible to choose a calendar file directly from the app; Calendars from Google Drive, Nextcloud and other cloud storage providers can be added this way and will stay up-to-date automatically
After adding a calendar, it will be opened direclty
Fixed: In special cases it could happen that a newly calendar added did not appear directly in the list of calendars
When viewing a calendar on narrow screens, the toolbar with menu stays and the title given to the calendar is displayed
Error messages from loading calendars are now more clear and can be translated
Added German translation
Split option to hide future or all entries into one for the entry’s date and one for the entry’s description
Added new commands to the LinCal calendar format to set an initial or force a permanent mode of displaying entry date and description (hide all, hide future, show all), see README
Calendar info and options now scroll away with entries, saving space
When viewing a calendar where the file cannot be found or contains errors, all settings are disabled
When a notification is due for a calendar and its file cannot be found or contains errors, an error notification is shown instead (clicking it launches the app)
Opening multiple instances of the list of calendars or the screen to add a new calendar (e.g. by clicking notification or by adding calendar from file manager) is now prevented
Added Japanese translation
First release
